courses: Algebra (Algebraic Manipulations, polynomials, sequences and series)
Combinatorics (fundamental principle of counting, combinations and permutations, probability)
Advanced Geometry (triangle theorems, circle theorems, polygons, 3D geometry)

work.summary: Continued neuromorphic computing research following RSI summer school, with Yudi Xie and Prof. James J. DiCarlo, on convergent neural representations.
Research internship at UCD Machine Learning for Medical Imaging Lab under Dr. Kathleen Curran
highlights: RSNA 2023 Collaborative Paper with Z. Chang, K. Curran: Improved Multimodal Diagnosis of Alzheimer's Disease through MRI and PET Image Fusion
T-junction detection
IMVIP 2023 Collaborative Paper with K. Curran: Spurious Correlation Mitigation in CXR Images via Reinforcement learning and Self-Supervision

volunteer.summary: Worked on a research project in neuromorphic computing at MIT BCS DiCarlo Lab under mentorship of Yudi Xie (22 June - 3 August)
highlights: Presented 'Convergent Neural Representations: Are artificial neural networks trained on different latent variables converging to similar representations of the ventral stream?'

volunteer.summary: University of Cambridge Centre for AI in Medicine Summer School (11 September - 15 September)
highlights: (Module) Time-Series in Healthcare
(Module) Individualised Treatment Effects
(Module) Synthetic Data
(Module) Causal Deep Learning ML for Clinical Trials
(Module) Large Language Models

volunteer.summary: UCD Medical Imaging Summer School (7 June - 21 August)
highlights: (Module) Fourier transforms in MRI Imaging
(Module) Federated Learning
(Module) Segmentation
(Module) Explainable AI
(Project) MRNet: Knee MRI Examination using Spatial Attention and Vision Transformers

volunteer.summary: UCL Medical Image Computing Summer School (MedICSS, 11 July - 15 July)
highlights: (Module) Improving hearing care pathways with the use of machine learning
(Module) Computer Vision in Minimally Invasive Surgery
(Module) Data-driven disease progression modelling
(Module) Surgical video understanding with AI
(Techniques) PET Imaging, Cardiovascular MRI, Lung Fibrosis Imaging, Tomography
(Project) How old is your brain? Predicting brain age with deep learning (Utilized Keras and Tensorflow libraries, Interacted with different medical imaging datatypes)

volunteer.summary: Volunteered and presented at the International Conference on Computer Vision
highlights: Presented a multimodal contrastive learning method for Alzheimer's detection (arxiv: 2308.15469)
Volunteered for organising the conference, which involves helping presenters and setting up IT equipment

volunteer.summary: Co-organiser of St Andrew's College Math Club
highlights: Preparing problems for maths club members, registering the school into competitions such as Canadian Senior Maths Contest, presenting key concepts in number theory, combinatorics, algebra and geometry to maths club members

volunteer.organization: St Andrew's College Competitive Programming Club
volunteer.summary: Started a Competitive programming club in St Andrew's College.
highlights: Preparing problems for coding club members, introducing new members to programming languages: C++, Python, registering the school into competitions such as Bebras Computing Challenge, presenting key concepts in Data Structures and Algorithms to club members
